posts.post_content: This is \*the\* limited bomb. I opened him from the first pack, and instantly decided to force draft spirits. This thing became an instant target for my opponents --they even [into the maw of hell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=into the maw of hell)ed it. But when I got to play around with him, he really made the clock go fast for my opponents. I landed on a good position because of this beast here.

posts.post_content:
Ladies and Gentlemen!  
  
Today we have two candidates vying for your votes to become Supreme Spirit Overlord! The one who slew unholy fiends in life, and continues to do so with his trusty angel in death, we present to you...The [Geist of Saint Traft](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geist of Saint Traft)!  
And next we have the one who by his mere presence gives Spirits the **Multiverse** over, a new lease on un-life,and renewed vigour, purpose and power , please welcome...[Drogskol Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drogskol Captain)!  
  
Your opening statements, Gentlemen!  
**Saint Traft**: I promise to continue to fight boldly along side my fellow spirits, with my beautiful Angel by my side!  
**Angel**: Aawww, Traft...you're so sweet.  
**Captain**: TO ME SPIRITS! (Spirit army shouts): DROGSKOL CAPTAIN!!!  
  
And now Gentlemen, you may begin the debate.  
**Saint Traft**: I need not the help of the Captain, for I am already Hexproof, the the boost he gives to my power and toughness are negligible! This makes me the clearly superio-  
  
b... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: JRE47 (1/28/2012 8:19:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is \*insane\*.  
Best lord of an already amazing cycle.  
  
This guy makes [Moorland Haunt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moorland Haunt) even nastier than it already is.  
  
I strongly suspect this, as well as [Call to the Kindred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call to the Kindred), are the reasons the Spirit tribe is rather small.  
They're still going to dominate Standard, small tribe or not, when they have backup like this.
posts.html:
This card is *insane*.
Best lord of an already amazing cycle.

This guy makes Moorland Haunt even nastier than it already is.

I strongly suspect this, as well as Call to the Kindred, are the reasons the Spirit tribe is rather small.
They're still going to dominate Standard, small tribe or not, when they have backup like this.

Posted By: aboblyndsae (1/28/2013 12:54:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ wulfsten  
  
It is a fairly rare mechanic as well, and, quite honestly, is only effective against heavy kill decks. It does nothing against sweeps, and those are the majority of what most people use. I, for one, would generally put a mizzium mortars in my deck over a ultimate price any day, due to its sweeping overload, and I would rather have a sever the bloodline over any other kill card, because even though it is more expensive, it sweeps. Thus, hexproof is generally ineffective. I can see where you would dislike it, assuming you use a burn/kill control deck, because it directly counters those decks, but, in the end, it does not have a significant impact on most strategies.
posts.html:
@ wulfsten

It is a fairly rare mechanic as well, and, quite honestly, is only effective against heavy kill decks. It does nothing against sweeps, and those are the majority of what most people use. I, for one, would generally put a mizzium mortars in my deck over a ultimate price any day, due to its sweeping overload, and I would rather have a sever the bloodline over any other kill card, because even though it is more expensive, it sweeps. Thus, hexproof is generally ineffective. I can see where you would dislike it, assuming you use a burn/kill control deck, because it directly counters those decks, but, in the end, it does not have a significant impact on most strategies.

Posted By: Banekiller (12/28/2012 11:38:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Is it just me who thinks hexproof is kind of a degenerate mechanic? I can handle shroud because it can be as much a hindrance as a benefit, but cards which are unblockable or untargetable really shouldn't have game-changing effects like this. The Captain here isn't the worst because you can just shock him, but man does stuff like Invisible Stalker or Troll Ascetic make me upset.
posts.html:
